G.L. c. 218, \u00a7 19,.proposition: This Court has jurisdiction over this matter pursuant to G.L. c. 218, § 19, as the amount in controversy does not exceed $50,000, and venue is proper in this Court because the events giving rise to this action occurred in Lynn, Massachusetts.

G.L. c. 148, \u00a7 26B,.proposition: It is Defendant's duty to maintain the common areas of the property, including hallway smoke detectors, in a safe and operable condition in compliance with G.L. c. 148, § 26B, which requires operable smoke detectors in multi-unit residential buildings.

G.L. c. 143, \u00a7 3Z..proposition: Defendant had a duty to exercise reasonable care in maintaining the premises, including ensuring functioning smoke detectors as required by Massachusetts law under G.L. c. 148, § 26B and G.L. c. 143, § 3Z.

527 CMR 1.00 et seq..proposition: Defendant's failure to maintain operational smoke detectors violated Massachusetts statutory and regulatory requirements, including 527 CMR 1.00 et seq., which establishes codes for fire safety.

G.L. c. 231, \u00a7 6F.proposition: Awarding Plaintiff the costs and expenses of this litigation, including reasonable attorney’s fees pursuant to G.L. c. 231, § 6F if deemed applicable;
